DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Developing symptom management plan may help relieve symptom related cancer cancer treatment help improve quality life . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study two different symptom management program see well work compare usual care patient recurrent persistent ovarian cancer , fallopian tube cancer , primary peritoneal cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Symptom Management Patients With Recurrent Persistent Ovarian Cancer , Fallopian Tube Cancer , Primary Peritoneal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve target symptom representation ( i.e. , decrease symptom severity , symptom-related distress , symptom consequence measure Symptom Representation Questionnaire [ SRQ ] ) patient recurrent persistent ovarian , fallopian tube , primary peritoneal cancer . Secondary - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve target symptom representation patient 4 week . - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve target symptom controllability patient 4 , 8 , 12 week . - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve indicator quality life ( QOL ) patient measure FACT-O CES-Depression inventory short form 4 , 8 , 12 week . - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve communication health care provider symptom , implementation new symptom management strategy ( health care provider recommend well patient-initiated change ) , perceive effectiveness strategy ( health care provider recommend well patient-initiated change ) patient 4 , 8 , 12 week . - Compare efficacy nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention improve patient-related barrier symptom management measure Symptom Management Barriers Questionnaire 4 , 8 , 12 week . Exploratory - Compare trajectory change overall symptom severity patient undergo nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention use monthly assessment explore potential long-term effect WRITE Symptoms© intervention . - Compare trajectory change QOL patient undergo nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention use monthly assessment explore potential long-term effect WRITE Symptoms© intervention . - Compare trajectory change symptom severity , distress , communication , implementation new strategy non-targeted symptom patient undergo nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© vs self-directed WRITE Symptoms© v usual care intervention use monthly assessment explore whether patient able generalize symptom management approach teach WRITE Symptoms© intervention non-targeted symptom . - Explore whether change symptom representation mediate change QOL patient 8 12 week . - Explore whether effect WRITE Symptoms© intervention primary secondary endpoint 8 12 week differ base follow patient characteristic assess baseline : age , education , ethnicity ; depression measure CES-D short form ; trait anxiety measure STAI ; optimism measure LOT-R ; social support measure ISEL ; symptom severity measure SRQ . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients stratify accord race/ethnicity ( non-Hispanic white v Hispanic non-white ) . Patients randomize 1 3 intervention arm . - Arm I ( nurse-delivered intervention ) : Patients give password-protected access web-based message board communicate research nurse . The nurse lead patient WRITE Symptoms© intervention module comprise representational assessment ; explore concerns/misconceptions/gaps/confusions ; create condition conceptual change ; introduce new information , goal setting , development symptom management plan ; summary via asynchronous posting patient 's message board . Patients work 3 select symptom use nurse-delivered WRITE Symptoms© intervention module approximately 4 week . Two week later , patient 's symptom management strategy desire make change evaluate additional interaction nurse via message board . The nurse encourage patient try new select strategy , continue effective strategy , work local health care provider ongoing process improve symptom management . Patients give access resource guide include self-care guide 26 symptom . They encourage use process teach 3 select symptom symptom arise course intervention . - Arm II ( self-directed intervention ) : Patients give password-protected access interactive web-based computer program lead modify WRITE Symptoms© intervention module ( comprise element arm I ) without guidance individualize recommendation nurse . Patients work 3 select symptom use WRITE Symptoms© intervention module approximately 4 week . Two week later , patient prompt computer program respond question symptom management strategy desire make change . The program generate encouragement patient try new select strategy , continue effective strategy , continue new approach symptom management local health care provider ongoing process improve symptom management . Patients give access resource guide include self-care guide 26 symptom . They encourage use process teach 3 select symptom symptom arise course intervention . - Arm III ( usual care ) : Patients give password-protected access online questionnaire . Patients prompt monthly complete online questionnaire . Patients receive standard symptom management local health care provider . In arm , patient complete online questionnaire assess outcome measure baseline , 4 , 8 , 12 week , every 4 week 1 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis ovarian , fallopian tube , primary peritoneal cancer recur persist follow primary therapy Active disease current treatment require Must experience ≥ 3 symptom associated ovarian cancer cancer treatment , include , limited , follow : Abdominal bloating cramp Nausea , vomiting , diarrhea Constipation Anorexia Anxiety Depression Dizziness Drowsiness Dry mouth Fatigue Headaches Hair loss Hot flash Memory concern Mood swing Mouth sores Pain Peripheral neuropathy Sexuality concern Sleep disturbance Shortness breath Skin rash palmarplantar erythrodysesthesia Urinary problem Weight gain loss PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : GOG performance status 02 Able read write English Access computer Internet require PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics Concurrent treatment clinical trial allow
